fieldData.title: Tax exemption for COVID-19 bonuses
fieldData.calc_minorCategory: Ensuring business continuity and support for essential services
fieldData.calc_subMinorCategory: Remuneration and rewards for workers in essential services
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Some companies pay their employees specific bonus payments for specific burdens or hardships caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, e.g. in the retail sector, healthcare and nursing care, or the Austrian railways. Bonus payments have been negotiated in some collective agreements, but also individual employers have opted for such premiums.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: With the third COVID-19 law issued on 4 April 2020, a tax exemption for bonus payments to employees was includes. It is in connection with special burdens due to the Corona crisis up to the amount of  €3,000 was passed.This tax exemption is not limited to any sectors or professions and only applies to payments in connection with the Corona crisis. Any such connection must be documented. The recipient does not need to face any particular difficulty (e.g. wearing masks during work). Furthermore, the payment has to be an  additional payment that has not usually been granted before; however, it does not have to be a one-time payment: The tax exemption also applies to recurring bonus payments in 2020 up to a total amount of €3000. The tax-free bonus can also be granted for employees in short-time work or for home office work. The bonus payment is also exempt from social security contributions, but not exempt from municipal tax, the employer's contribution and the mandatory contribution to the Federal Economic Chamber.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: The social partners' involvement is unknown.
